results.title: The Day Before I Went Away
results.creator_credit: Guo Jian, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Guo Jian’s saucy and sinister reappropriation of Chinese propaganda painting techniques is heightened by this animation of his allegorical work ‘The Day Before I Went Away’.
results.description: Guo Jian’s saucy and sinister reappropriation of Chinese propaganda painting techniques is heightened by this animation of his allegorical work ‘The Day Before I Went Away’.

results.title: Blurring the boundaries
results.creator_credit: Craig Walsh, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Repurposing documentation of his wild installation, where unexpected images are projected onto a shop window in Vietnam, Craig Walsh captures the interaction between art and its audience.
results.description: Repurposing documentation of his wild installation, where unexpected images are projected onto a shop window in Vietnam, Craig Walsh captures the interaction between art and its audience.

results.title: Blood disco: Dirk wears white socks
results.creator_credit: Scott Redford, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Scott Redford’s visually rampant fist-in-mouth and Egyptian eye images riff on the early surrealist films of Luis Buñuel, via a queer punk aesthetic, in this pop-savvy work.
results.description: Scott Redford’s visually rampant fist-in-mouth and Egyptian eye images riff on the early surrealist films of Luis Buñuel, via a queer punk aesthetic, in this pop-savvy work.
description_for_label: Scott Redford’s visually rampant fist-in-mouth and Egyptian eye images riff on the early surrealist films of Luis Buñuel, via a queer punk aesthetic, in this pop-savvy work.

results.title: A 30 second portrait, starring Phil Lombardo
results.creator_credit: Cherine Fahd, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.
results.description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.
description_for_label: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.

results.title: Fluid
results.brief_description: Fluid is an abstract, miniature ecosystem made up of a handful of different species of organisms who live inside the computer screen. Fluid is also a game about systems, digital aesthetics and green ethics. The final objective of the game cleaning up the ecosystem!
results.description: Fluid is an abstract, miniature ecosystem made up of a handful of different species of organisms who live inside the computer screen. Fluid is also a game about systems, digital aesthetics and green ethics. The final objective of the game cleaning up the ecosystem!
description_for_label: Fluid is an abstract, miniature ecosystem made up of a handful of different species of organisms who live inside the computer screen. Fluid is also a game about systems, digital aesthetics and green ethics. The final objective of the game cleaning up the ecosystem!
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - DAMP (Full potato jacket)
results.brief_description: The scene is familiar. A scene you know well. A buffet setting of multinational brands adorns a beautifully set table. Products which for years you have been told you want; you need. The camera pans the table. You recognise everything. So what happens when the desirable turns undesirable? Melbourne art collective DAMP wage war on themselves in a gluttonous, misappropriation of food. A food fight of excessive proportions aims to subvert the subliminal desire global advertising has imposed, via mass media, on mainstream Australia.

results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - Destiny Deacon (Over d-Fence)
results.brief_description: A half-hour program that references the global success of the soap-opera Neighbours. Consisting of three nine-minute segments by an emerging documentarian, an emerging fiction moving image maker, and by a visual artist, Neighbours (the remix) will playfully subvert and imaginatively redraw the landscape of Australia suburbia. As part of Neighbours (the remix) there will be interspersed ad-breaks (30 second duration each) by five leading, established art practitioners.

results.title: Memo
results.creator_credit: Matthew Riley, David Atkinson and Jeremy Parker
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works selected by AIM director David Atkinson as representing the best interactive work produced by the AIM centre up until 2004. Memo is a journal-like collection of imagery, text and observations that looks at the permeation of the mediascape, technology and popular culture with the everyday. Intrigued by how this convergence shapes and influence what we perceive as self, experience, memory and identity I have examined and re-presented visual and verbal material derived from daily life-sounds, samples, imagery, text and language.
A subtle and very beautiful piece of interactive design and visual patina. Selected for exhibition at MILIA’s “New Talent Pavilion” 2001, Cannes, France.
